artists.name: The Nordic Council
artists.style: Juggling, acrobatics and live music merge in a powerful, poetic circus experience
artists.concept: Nordic magic art: The piece is humorous, surprising and profound ‚Äì inspired by everyday rituals in Scandinavia, transformed into movement and visual language

artists.name: Art for Rainy Days
artists.award: Winner of the Latvian Dance Awards 2023/2024
artists.style: Their performance combines elements from dance, circus and contemporary movement
artists.concept: They use physical expression forms, movement language and visual metaphors in their choreography
artists.recognition: The Latvian Dance Award is considered one of the highest honors in the field of dance/art in Latvia

items.title: Opening Night - Nordic Elegance
items.description: Experience the premiere with The Nordic Council. A show full of Nordic elegance and poetic acrobatics that opens the festival with style.

items.title: Matinee - Family Circus
items.description: The perfect afternoon show for families. Art for Rainy Days presents playful and interactive circus art that delights children and adults alike.
items.audience: Ideal for families with children from age 4

items.title: Evening Gala - Poetry in Motion
items.description: The main show of the festival! Both artist groups unite for a spectacular evening gala with the best acts from both shows.
items.artist: The Nordic Council & Art for Rainy Days

items.title: Sunday Matinee - Nordic Elegance
items.description: Relaxed Sunday afternoon with The Nordic Council. Enjoy Nordic circus poetry in a calm atmosphere - perfect for a cozy Sunday.
items.audience: Perfect for relaxed Sundays, from age 6

items.title: Finale - Art for Rainy Days
items.description: The grand finale of the festival! Art for Rainy Days bids farewell with an emotional and unforgettable closing performance.

venue.title: Pepe Dome
venue.subtitle: A place Munich has never seen before
venue.description: Since August 1st, 2025, it stands in Ostpark: the Pepe Dome. A geodesic dome surrounded by greenery, creating space for artistry, dance, and culture ‚Äì modern, open, and inspiring. Its height and architecture enable spectacular aerial acrobatics, while the intimate atmosphere makes every encounter feel personal.
venue.uniqueness: Because the Dome stands for only a limited time, every visit has something unique about it.
venue.experienceSubtitle: The Dome offers more than just shows

about.title: Freeman Festival | Zeit f√ºr Zirkus
about.subtitle: Celebrating Freedom of Artistic Expression, Rooted in Connection and Unity
about.tagline: Art is freedom. Circus is freedom. You are free.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Freeman Festival celebrates artistic freedom by bringing together international circus artists to explore identity, tradition, and innovation through bold, boundary-pushing performance. In a time of rising division, we come together in movement and expression to reclaim freedom‚Äînot just as individuals, but as a collective act of unity.

munich.title: Why Munich?
paragraphs: Munich's history is steeped in artistic rebellion and innovation. From the expressive ruptures of the Blauer Reiter group to the boundary-breaking performances of the Dada movement, the city has long been a ground zero for movements that redefine culture and confront the status quo.

In hosting Freeman Festival here, we honor this radical past‚Äîwhile rooting our vision in the present, where artistic freedom is more necessary than ever in the face of global tensions, censorship, and polarization.

circus.title: Contemporary Circus as Language
circus.description: Contemporary circus, with its rejection of definition and tradition, becomes a perfect meeting ground. It offers a radically open space where cultures, techniques, and bodies can speak together. Here, circus is not bound by genre or geography. It is a place where a rope, a gesture, or a fall can carry the weight of a homeland or the dream of a borderless world.

questions.title: It asks:
items: How do we stay grounded while reaching across cultures?
How can we use our bodies to tell stories that are both personal and political?
What does it mean to reclaim tradition while inventing new languages?

vision.title: Our Chorus of Freedom
vision.description: This festival is not just about celebrating the individual voice‚Äîit's about creating a chorus. A space where freedom becomes collective, where difference is a source of strength, and where unity is not uniformity, but a shared commitment to truth, vulnerability, and artistic courage.

freedom.closing: In Munich, in this moment, we come together‚Äîacross borders and disciplines.

cta.title: Become Part of the Movement
cta.subtitle: Experience artistic freedom in its purest form
